N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 281.6 - Institution of appeal

State Regulations

The appellant shall institute an appeal to the commissioner
by: (a) preparing an appeal, in letter
format signed by appellant or appellant' s counsel, that shall include the
following: (1)
name of appellant; (2)
name of arbitrator; (3)
date of arbitrator's decision; (4)
date of chancellor's decision; (5)
date of receipt by appellant of written
notice of the chancellor' s decision; (6)
a clear and concise statement, not to
exceed 500 words, setting forth appellant's claim and showing that the
appellant is entitled to the relief sought; (7)
citations to pages of the transcript and
exhibits supporting appellant' s claim; (8)
the name, address and phone number of
appellant or, if appellant is represented by counsel, of appellant's
counsel; (b) effecting
personal service of a copy of the appeal, by a person not a party to the appeal
who is over 18 years, upon: (1)
the
chancellor, or a person designated to accept service on behalf of the
chancellor; and
(2)
the community
school district superintendent who initiated the arbitration proceeding, or a
person in the office of such superintendent who has been designated to accept
service; and
(c) immediately upon completion of personal service, transmitting the original
appeal, together with affidavits of service in the form set forth in this
subdivision, by first class mail to the Office of Counsel, New York State

Education Department, State Education Building, Room 148, Albany, New York
12234. FORM FOR AFFIDAVIT OF PERSONAL SERVICE
